text: I'm James Gunn and I'm the writer and
director of guardians of the galaxy vol
2 so this takes place in about the
middle of the film with actress Zoe
Saldana playing Gamora and her adopted
sisters played by Karen Gillan as nebula
nebula is on the warpath and what's the
kill her sister and she's come to the
planet where Gamora is I call this scene
North by Northwest because it is
referencing the great Hitchcock film the
crop duster scene in that movie I also
think a lot of spy versus spy the scene
is pretty long you're going to see about
half the scene here but the scene
actually they switch power positions
many times throughout and things get a
little bit more and more outlandish as
time goes on I think this scene was
unique in that I actually drew the
storyboards for the scene before I ever
wrote any words to put pen to paper the
very first thing is it came to me
visually and the scene is remained
almost exactly the same from that first
moment and the other thing that's unique
about it is there's no uh music in the
scene which is unusual especially in a
Guardians movie where we're chock-full
of music the visual effects here have
been done by scanline the sisters go
deeper and deeper into this hole as they
go deeper and deeper into their
relationship Gamora picks up a giant gun
which is the blaster that's fallen off
of the M ship that nebula is driving and
I thought that was just a fun way to
take things up to the next level I had
seen the rock do his thing with a giant
blaster in Fast and Furious 7 and I
decided to one-up that with Zoe Saldana
grabbing a gun that's you know eight
times as big as the Rock's gun in Fast
and Furious
[Music]
Oh
you
